verses.verse: And the whole <S%G537><s%> multitude <S%G4128><s%> of them arose, <S%G450><s%> and led <S%G71><s%> him to Pilate. <S%G4091><s%>

And they began <S%G756><s%> to accuse <S%G2723><s%> him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> We found <S%G2147><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> fellow perverting <S%G1294><s%> the nation, <S%G1484><s%> and forbidding <S%G2967><s%> to give <S%G1325><s%> tribute <S%G5411><s%> to Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> that he himself <S%G1438><s%> is Christ <S%G5547><s%> a King. <S%G935><s%>

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> Are <S%G1488><s%> you the King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews? <S%G2453><s%> And he answered <S%G611><s%> him and said, <S%G5346><s%> You say <S%G3004><s%> it.

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> to the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and to the people, <S%G3793><s%> I find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> fault <S%G158><s%> in this <S%G5129><s%> man. <S%G444><s%>

And they were the more <S%G2001><s%> fierce, <S%G2001><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> He stirs <S%G383><s%> up the people, <S%G2992><s%> teaching <S%G1321><s%> throughout <S%G2596><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> Jewry, <S%G2449><s%> beginning <S%G756><s%> from Galilee <S%G1056><s%> to this <S%G5602><s%> place. <S%G5602><s%>
When Pilate <S%G4091><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> of Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> he asked <S%G1905><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> were a Galilaean. <S%G1057><s%>

And as soon as he knew <S%G1921><s%> that he belonged <S%G1510><s%> to Herod's <S%G2264><s%> jurisdiction, <S%G1849><s%> he sent <S%G375><s%> him to Herod, <S%G2264><s%> who himself <S%G846><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> was at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> that time. <S%G2250><s%>

And when Herod <S%G2264><s%> saw <S%G1492><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> he was exceeding <S%G3029><s%> glad: <S%G5463><s%> for he was desirous <S%G2309><s%> to see <S%G1492><s%> him of a long <S%G2425><s%> season, because <S%G1223><s%> he had heard <S%G191><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> things of him; and he hoped <S%G1679><s%> to have seen <S%G1492><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> miracle <S%G4592><s%> done <S%G1096><s%> by him.
Then <S%G1161><s%> he questioned <S%G1905><s%> with him in many <S%G2425><s%> words; <S%G3056><s%> but he answered <S%G611><s%> him nothing. <S%G3762><s%>
And the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and scribes <S%G1122><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> and vehemently <S%G2159><s%> accused <S%G2723><s%> him.

And Herod <S%G2264><s%> with his men <S%G4753><s%> of war <S%G4753><s%> set <S%G1848><s%> him at <S%G1848><s%> nothing, <S%G1848><s%> and mocked <S%G1702><s%> him, and arrayed <S%G4016><s%> him in a gorgeous <S%G2986><s%> robe, <S%G2066><s%> and sent <S%G375><s%> him again <S%G375><s%> to Pilate. <S%G4091><s%>

And the same <S%G846><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> and Herod <S%G2264><s%> were made <S%G1096><s%> friends <S%G5384><s%> together: <S%G3326><s%> <S%G240><s%> for before <S%G4391><s%> they were at <S%G1722><s%> enmity <S%G2189><s%> between <S%G4314><s%> themselves. <S%G1438><s%>
And Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> when he had called <S%G4779><s%> together <S%G4779><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the rulers <S%G758><s%> and the people, <S%G2992><s%>

Said <S%G2036><s%> to them, You have brought <S%G4374><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to me, as one that perverts <S%G654><s%> the people: <S%G2992><s%> and, behold, <S%G2400><s%> I, having examined <S%G350><s%> him before <S%G1799><s%> you, have found <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> fault <S%G158><s%> in this <S%G5126><s%> man <S%G444><s%> touching those things whereof you accuse <S%G2723><s%> him:

No, <S%G235><s%> nor <S%G3761><s%> yet Herod: <S%G2264><s%> for I sent <S%G375><s%> you to him; and, see, <S%G2400><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> is done <S%G4238><s%> to him.
I will therefore <S%G3767><s%> chastise <S%G3811><s%> him, and release <S%G630><s%> him.
(For of necessity <S%G2192><s%> <S%G318><s%> he must release <S%G630><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> to them at <S%G2596><s%> the feast. <S%G1859><s%>)
And they cried <S%G349><s%> out all <S%G3829><s%> at <S%G3826><s%> once, <S%G3826><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Away with this <S%G5126><s%> man, and release <S%G630><s%> to us Barabbas: <S%G912><s%>

(Who <S%G3748><s%> for a certain <S%G5100><s%> sedition <S%G4714><s%> made <S%G1096><s%> in the city, <S%G4172><s%> and for murder, <S%G5408><s%> was cast <S%G906><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> prison. <S%G5438><s%>)
Pilate <S%G4091><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> willing <S%G2309><s%> to release <S%G630><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> spoke <S%G4377><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> to them.
But they cried, <S%G2019><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Crucify <S%G4717><s%> him, crucify <S%G4717><s%> him.

And he said <S%G2036><s%> to them the third <S%G5154><s%> time, Why, <S%G1063><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> evil <S%G2556><s%> has he done? <S%G4160><s%> I have found <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> cause <S%G158><s%> of death <S%G2288><s%> in him: I will therefore <S%G3767><s%> chastise <S%G3811><s%> him, and let him go. <S%G630><s%>

And they were instant <S%G1945><s%> with loud <S%G3173><s%> voices, <S%G5456><s%> requiring <S%G154><s%> that he might be crucified. <S%G4717><s%> And the voices <S%G5456><s%> of them and of the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> prevailed. <S%G2729><s%>
And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> gave sentence <S%G1948><s%> that it should be as they required. <S%G155><s%>

And he released <S%G630><s%> to them him that for sedition <S%G4714><s%> and murder <S%G5408><s%> was cast <S%G906><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> prison, <S%G5438><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> they had desired; <S%G154><s%> but he delivered <S%G3860><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> to their will. <S%G2307><s%>

And as they led <S%G520><s%> him away, <S%G520><s%> they laid hold <S%G1949><s%> on one <S%G5100><s%> Simon, <S%G4613><s%> a Cyrenian, <S%G2956><s%> coming <S%G2064><s%> out of the country, <S%G68><s%> and on <S%G2007><s%> him they laid <S%G2007><s%> the cross, <S%G4716><s%> that he might bear <S%G5342><s%> it after <S%G3693><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And there followed <S%G190><s%> him a great <S%G4183><s%> company <S%G4128><s%> of people, <S%G2992><s%> and of women, <S%G1135><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> bewailed <S%G2875><s%> and lamented <S%G2354><s%> him.

But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> turning <S%G4762><s%> to them said, <S%G2036><s%> Daughters <S%G2364><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> weep <S%G2799><s%> not for me, but weep <S%G2799><s%> for yourselves, <S%G1438><s%> and for your <S%G5216><s%> children. <S%G5043><s%>

For, behold, <S%G2400><s%> the days <S%G2250><s%> are coming, <S%G2064><s%> in the which <S%G3739><s%> they shall say, <S%G2046><s%> Blessed <S%G3107><s%> are the barren, <S%G4723><s%> and the wombs <S%G2836><s%> that never <S%G3756><s%> bore, <S%G1080><s%> and the breasts <S%G3149><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> never <S%G3756><s%> gave suck. <S%G2337><s%>
Then <S%G5119><s%> shall they begin <S%G756><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%> to the mountains, <S%G3735><s%> Fall <S%G4098><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> us; and to the hills, <S%G1015><s%> Cover <S%G2572><s%> us.
For if <S%G1487><s%> they do <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things in a green <S%G5200><s%> tree, <S%G3586><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> shall be done <S%G1096><s%> in the dry? <S%G3584><s%>
And there were also <S%G2532><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> other, <S%G2087><s%> malefactors, <S%G2557><s%> led <S%G71><s%> with him to be put <S%G337><s%> to death. <S%G337><s%>

And when <S%G3753><s%> they were come <S%G565><s%> to the place, <S%G5117><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> is called <S%G2564><s%> Calvary, <S%G2898><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> they crucified <S%G4717><s%> him, and the malefactors, <S%G2557><s%> one <S%G3739><s%> <S%G3303><s%> on <S%G1537><s%> the right <S%G1188><s%> hand, and the other <S%G3739><s%> on <S%G1537><s%> the left. <S%G710><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> Father, <S%G3962><s%> forgive <S%G863><s%> them; for they know <S%G1492><s%> not what <S%G5101><s%> they do. <S%G4160><s%> And they parted <S%G1266><s%> his raiment, <S%G2440><s%> and cast <S%G906><s%> lots. <S%G2819><s%>

And the people <S%G2992><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> beholding. <S%G2334><s%> And the rulers <S%G758><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> with them derided <S%G1592><s%> him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> He saved <S%G4982><s%> others; <S%G243><s%> let him save <S%G4982><s%> himself, <S%G1438><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> he be Christ, <S%G5547><s%> the chosen <S%G1588><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
And the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> mocked <S%G1702><s%> him, coming <S%G4334><s%> to him, and offering <S%G4374><s%> him vinegar, <S%G3690><s%>
And saying, <S%G3004><s%> If <S%G1487><s%> you be the king <S%G935><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> save <S%G4982><s%> yourself. <S%G4572><s%>

And a superscription <S%G1923><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> was written <S%G1125><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> him in letters <S%G1121><s%> of Greek, <S%G1673><s%> and Latin, <S%G4513><s%> and Hebrew, <S%G1444><s%> THIS <S%G3778><s%> IS THE KING <S%G935><s%> OF THE JEWS. <S%G2453><s%>

And one <S%G1520><s%> of the malefactors <S%G2557><s%> which were hanged <S%G2910><s%> railed <S%G987><s%> on him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> If <S%G1487><s%> you be Christ, <S%G5547><s%> save <S%G4982><s%> yourself <S%G4572><s%> and us.

But the other <S%G2087><s%> answering <S%G611><s%> rebuked <S%G2008><s%> him, saying, <S%G3004><s%> Do not you fear <S%G5399><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> seeing <S%G3754><s%> you are <S%G1488><s%> in the same <S%G846><s%> condemnation? <S%G2917><s%>

And we indeed <S%G3303><s%> justly; <S%G1346><s%> for we receive <S%G618><s%> the due <S%G514><s%> reward <S%G514><s%> of our deeds: <S%G3739><s%> <S%G4238><s%> but this <S%G3778><s%> man has done <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> amiss. <S%G824><s%>
And he said <S%G3004><s%> to Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> remember <S%G3415><s%> me when <S%G3752><s%> you come <S%G2064><s%> into <S%G1722><s%> your kingdom. <S%G932><s%>
And Jesus <S%G2424><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> to him, Truly <S%G281><s%> I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, To day <S%G4594><s%> shall you be with me in paradise. <S%G3857><s%>

And it was about <S%G5616><s%> the sixth <S%G1623><s%> hour, <S%G5610><s%> and there was a darkness <S%G4655><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> all <S%G3650><s%> the earth <S%G1093><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> the ninth <S%G1766><s%> hour. <S%G5610><s%>
And the sun <S%G2246><s%> was darkened, <S%G4654><s%> and the veil <S%G2665><s%> of the temple <S%G3485><s%> was rent <S%G4977><s%> in the middle. <S%G3319><s%>

And when Jesus <S%G2424><s%> had cried <S%G5455><s%> with a loud <S%G3173><s%> voice, <S%G5456><s%> he said, <S%G2036><s%> Father, <S%G3962><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> your hands <S%G5495><s%> I commend <S%G3908><s%> my spirit: <S%G4151><s%> and having said <S%G2036><s%> thus, <S%G3778><s%> he gave up the ghost. <S%G1606><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> when the centurion <S%G1543><s%> saw <S%G1492><s%> what <S%G3588><s%> was done, <S%G1096><s%> he glorified <S%G1392><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> Certainly <S%G3689><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> was a righteous <S%G1342><s%> man. <S%G444><s%>

And all <S%G3956><s%> the people <S%G3793><s%> that came <S%G4836><s%> together <S%G4836><s%> to that sight, <S%G2335><s%> beholding <S%G2334><s%> the things which were done, <S%G1096><s%> smote <S%G5180><s%> their breasts, <S%G4738><s%> and returned. <S%G5290><s%>

And all <S%G3956><s%> his acquaintance, <S%G1110><s%> and the women <S%G1135><s%> that followed <S%G4870><s%> him from Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> afar <S%G3113><s%> off, beholding <S%G3708><s%> these <S%G5023><s%> things.
And, behold, <S%G2400><s%> there was a man <S%G435><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Joseph, <S%G2501><s%> a counselor; <S%G1010><s%> and he was a good <S%G18><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> and a just: <S%G1342><s%>

(The same <S%G3778><s%> had not consented <S%G4784><s%> to the counsel <S%G1012><s%> and deed <S%G4234><s%> of them;) he was of Arimathaea, <S%G707><s%> a city <S%G4172><s%> of the Jews: <S%G2453><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> waited <S%G4327><s%> for the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
This <S%G3778><s%> man went <S%G4334><s%> to Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> and begged <S%G154><s%> the body <S%G4983><s%> of Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>

And he took <S%G2507><s%> it down, <S%G2507><s%> and wrapped <S%G1794><s%> it in linen, <S%G4616><s%> and laid <S%G5087><s%> it in a sepulcher <S%G3418><s%> that was hewn <S%G2991><s%> in stone, <S%G2991><s%> wherein <S%G3757><s%> never <S%G3764><s%> man <S%G3762><s%> before <S%G3764><s%> was laid. <S%G2749><s%>
And that day <S%G2250><s%> was the preparation, <S%G3904><s%> and the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> drew <S%G2020><s%> on. <S%G2020><s%>

And the women <S%G1135><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> came <S%G4905><s%> with him from Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> followed <S%G2628><s%> after, <S%G2628><s%> and beheld <S%G2300><s%> the sepulcher, <S%G3419><s%> and how <S%G5613><s%> his body <S%G4983><s%> was laid. <S%G5087><s%>

And they returned, <S%G5290><s%> and prepared <S%G2090><s%> spices <S%G759><s%> and ointments; <S%G3464><s%> and rested <S%G2270><s%> the sabbath <S%G4521><s%> day according <S%G2596><s%> to the commandment. <S%G1785><s%>
